meanings.definition: To shape or reduce (a metal object) by hammering or pressure.
meanings.sent1: The blacksmith was swaging the metal into a beautiful sword.
meanings.sent2: The workers were swaging the metal sheets to form intricate designs.
meanings.sent3: The robot tried swaging the metal, but ended up making a funny-looking sculpture.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a hammer swaging his heart, leaving it reshaped and vulnerable.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic sound of swaging echoed through the workshop, creating a symphony of craftsmanship.

meanings.definition: A tool or machine used for swaging.
meanings.sent1: The swaging tool was essential for shaping the metal accurately.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic carefully selected the right swaging machine for the job.
meanings.sent3: The swaging device looked like a strange alien gadget from a sci-fi movie.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was a swaging tool, molding ideas into tangible creations.
meanings.sent5: The shiny swaging equipment gleamed under the bright lights of the workshop.

meanings.sent1: The swaging process required precision and skill to achieve the desired shape.
meanings.sent2: The factory had a dedicated area for the swaging of metal components.
meanings.sent3: The swaging procedure seemed like a magical transformation from raw material to finished product.
meanings.sent4: Time was the swaging of memories, compressing them into lasting impressions.
meanings.sent5: The artistry of swaging brought life to the otherwise dull metal sheets.
